verbs.description: reflag (third-person singular simple present reflags, present participle reflagging, simple past and past participle reflagged)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To change the flag on a vessel, etc.
examples: The Navy assumed responsibility for escorting the reflagged tankers in the Gulf and through the perilous Strait of Hormuz...

entries.meaning: (computing, transitive) To flag (mark with a variable) again or differently.
examples: In addition, it is only necessary to reflag the cells that lie along the free surface and some of their neighbor cells in each computational step.
